intro: Gomphandra gracilis, commonly known as the slender gomphandra, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences and are usually pale yellow or greenish in color. Gomphandra gracilis is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
